page.title: 09A Dairy Farm near Combwich.
page.content: Moxhill Farm is a dairy farm typical of this area.The owner has{135 acres of land.The land is flat and suitably fertilized for good grazing. Mr Venner has{85 cows,33 in calf {heifers,18 calves and 2 bulls.}One bull is called Prince Primary of Staplegrove.He is 8 years old.He was huge but he had stopped growing at 2 years old.The other bull was called Snowmaker and he was 3 years old and was also huge.The farmer employed only 1 worker largely to carry out the daily milking.8 cows are lead into the milking parlour and connected up to the milking machine which works automatically.Each cow gives between 19_23 litres of milk.The farm is very modernised with much large equipment,a dung spreader,4 tractors and a slurry spreader.The bulls attend the cows to keep them in calf or A.I.is used.
